Modul htl.steyr.javafx_minesweeper_tplatzer
Package htl.steyr.javafx_minesweeper_tplatzer.controller

Klasse MenuController

java.lang.Object
htl.steyr.javafx_minesweeper_tplatzer.controller.Controller
htl.steyr.javafx_minesweeper_tplatzer.controller.MenuController
public class MenuController extends Controller
Controller class for managing the main menu UI in the Minesweeper game.

This class handles the main menu functionality, including:

  • Starting the game with selected difficulty
  • Accessing the leaderboard
  • Changing the username
  • Toggling the visual style and sound effects
  • Resetting local best times

  • Konstruktordetails

    • MenuController

      public MenuController(String username, String style, boolean muted)
      Constructs a new MenuController with the specified username, style, and mute settings.

      This constructor initializes the controller with the player's username, the chosen visual style, and whether sound effects are muted.

      Parameter:
      username - The username of the player.
      style - The visual style of the menu (e.g., "retro", "modern").
      muted - true if sound effects are muted, false otherwise.

  • Methodendetails

    • start

      public void start(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
      Starts the main menu UI.

      This method sets the Stage for the menu, initializes all UI components, plays the background music if sound effects are not muted, and displays the menu window.

      Parameter:
      stage - The Stage where the menu will be displayed.

    • initializeWindow

      private void initializeWindow()
      Initializes the layout and appearance of the main menu window.

      This method configures the root container, sets the layout of all components (header, game mode selection, footer), applies stylesheets for visual styling, and prepares the scene for display.

    • startGame

      private void startGame(String difficulty)
      Starts a new game with the specified difficulty.

      This method stops the background music of the menu and initializes a new instance of GameController with the given difficulty level, the current username, style, and mute settings. The game is displayed in the same Stage.

      Parameter:
      difficulty - The selected difficulty level (e.g., "beginner", "advanced", "pro").

    • initializeUserElements

      private void initializeUserElements()
      Initializes the user interface elements of the menu.

      This method sets up the primary sections of the menu, including:

      • The header section (title and username)
      • The game mode selection box
      • The footer section (control buttons and other utilities)

    • initializeHeaderBox

      private void initializeHeaderBox()
      Initializes the header section of the menu.

      This method sets up the header, which includes:

      • The username display (aligned to the top right, clickable to change the username)
      • The title of the menu ("Bomb-Disposal-Simulator")
      The header is added as the first child of the root container.

    • changeUserName

      private void changeUserName()
      Changes the username of the player.

      This method stops the menu background music and opens the username selection menu by initializing a new UsernameMenuController. The current username, style, and mute settings are passed to the controller.

    • initializeChooseGameModeBox

      private void initializeChooseGameModeBox()
      Initializes the game mode selection box in the menu.

      This method sets up a VBox container for selecting game modes and control buttons. It includes a title, difficulty selection buttons, and additional control options (e.g., style, mute).

    • initializeControlButtonsBox

      private void initializeControlButtonsBox()
      Initializes the control buttons box in the menu.

      This method sets up a HBox container for the control buttons, which include:

      • A button to toggle sound effects (Mute SFX)
      • A button to toggle the visual style (Choose Style)

    • initializeDifficultyBoxes

      private void initializeDifficultyBoxes()
      Initializes the difficulty selection boxes in the menu.

      This method sets up an HBox container to hold the buttons for selecting game difficulty levels. Each button is associated with a difficulty ("beginner", "advanced", "pro") and displays the best time for that level.

    • initializeFooterBox

      private void initializeFooterBox()
      Initializes the footer section of the menu.

      This method sets up an HBox container for the footer, which includes:

      • A button to reset local best times
      • A button to open the leaderboard
      • A spacer to ensure proper alignment

    • createDifficultyBox

      private javafx.scene.layout.VBox createDifficultyBox(String difficulty, int bestTime)
      Creates a difficulty selection box for a specific game difficulty.

      This method generates a VBox containing:

      • A button for selecting the specified difficulty level
      • A label displaying the best time for that difficulty
      The button and label are styled and aligned appropriately.
      Parameter:
      difficulty - The difficulty level (e.g., "beginner", "advanced", "pro").
      bestTime - The player's best time for the specified difficulty.
      Gibt zurück:
      A VBox containing the button and best time label for the specified difficulty.

    • initializeMuteSfxButton

      private void initializeMuteSfxButton()
      Initializes the "Mute SFX" button in the menu.

      This method creates and styles a button that allows the player to toggle sound effects on or off. The button's appearance updates dynamically based on whether sound effects are currently muted. Clicking the button triggers the toggleMute() method to switch the mute state.

    • initializeChooseStyleButton

      private void initializeChooseStyleButton()
      Initializes the "Choose Style" button in the menu.

      This method creates and styles a button that allows the player to toggle between different visual styles (e.g., "retro" or "modern"). The button's label reflects the current style in uppercase. Clicking the button triggers the toggleStyle() method to switch the style.

    • initializeLeaderboardButton

      private void initializeLeaderboardButton()
      Initializes the "Leaderboard" button in the menu.

      This method creates and styles a button that allows the player to view the global leaderboard. Clicking the button triggers the showLeaderboardWindow() method to open the leaderboard window.

    • showLeaderboardWindow

      private void showLeaderboardWindow()
      Displays the leaderboard window.

      This method creates a new instance of LeaderboardController, passing the current style, and starts it to show the global leaderboard in a new window.

    • toggleStyle

      private void toggleStyle()
      Toggles the visual style of the menu between "retro" and "modern".

      This method switches the current style, updates the "Choose Style" button label to reflect the new style, stops the background music, and restarts the menu with the updated settings.

    • toggleMute

      private void toggleMute()
      Toggles the mute state for sound effects and background music.

      This method switches the current mute state, updates the "Mute SFX" button's appearance to reflect the new state, stops or starts the background music based on the mute status, and ensures consistent UI feedback.

    • initializeResetLocalBestTimesButton

      private void initializeResetLocalBestTimesButton()
      Initializes the "Reset Local Best Times" button in the menu.

      This method creates and styles a button that allows the player to reset their local best times. Clicking the button triggers the resetBestTimes() method to clear the stored best times.

    • loadBestTime

      private int loadBestTime(String difficulty)
      Loads the best time for a specific difficulty level from the user's data.

      This method retrieves the player's best time for the given difficulty by accessing the saved user data. If the difficulty is invalid, it returns Integer.MAX_VALUE as a fallback.

      Parameter:
      difficulty - The difficulty level for which to retrieve the best time (e.g., "beginner", "advanced", "pro").
      Gibt zurück:
      The best time for the specified difficulty, or Integer.MAX_VALUE if the difficulty is invalid.

    • resetBestTimes

      private void resetBestTimes()
      Resets the player's local best times.

      This method clears all saved best times by creating a new UserData object with only the username retained. The updated data is saved, and the menu is restarted to reflect the changes. Background music is stopped before restarting the menu.

    • formatUsername

      private String formatUsername(String username)
      Formats the username to a fixed width for consistent display.

      This method ensures the username is aligned to a width of 16 characters by padding it with spaces if necessary. This is useful for maintaining a uniform layout in the UI.

      Parameter:
      username - The username to format.
      Gibt zurück:
      The formatted username as a string padded to 16 characters.

    • formatBestTime

      private String formatBestTime(int bestTime)
      Formats the best time for display in the menu.

      This method converts the best time into a three-digit string. If the best time equals Integer.MAX_VALUE, it indicates no valid time is set and returns a placeholder ("---").

      Parameter:
      bestTime - The best time to format.
      Gibt zurück:
      A string representation of the best time, or "---" if no valid time is available.

      Gibt zurück:

    • setMuted

      Sets the mute state for sound effects and background music.
      Parameter:
      muted - true to mute, false to unmute.

    • getMuteSfxButton

    • setMuteSfxButton

      public void setMuteSfxButton(javafx.scene.control.Button muteSfxButton)
      Sets the "Mute SFX" button.
      Parameter:
